intro: Cyclopogon longibracteatus, commonly known as the long-bract cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its distinctive appearance. The plant features a slender, unbranched stem with a crown of pinnate leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small, yellowish flowers, which are surrounded by elongated bracts. Cyclopogon longibracteatus is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
